IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: To educate students of diverse backgrounds in the areas of fine arts, architecture, design, and writing
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE CALIFORNIA COLLEGE OF THE ARTS (THE COLLEGE) IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION FOUNDED IN 1907 TO EDUCATE STUDENTS OF DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS IN THE AREAS OF FINE ARTS, ARCHITECTURE, DESIGN, AND WRITING. THE COLLEGE PROVIDES INSTRUCTION IN A WIDE VARIETY OF MEDIA AND IS A SIGNIFICANT FACTOR IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE ARTS IN NORTHERN CALIFORNIA. THE COLLEGE HAS CAMPUSES IN SAN FRANCISCO AND OAKLAND.
IRS990.Description: POST SECONDARY EDUCATIONTHE CALIFORNIA COLLEGE OF THE ARTS (THE COLLEGE) IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTION FOUNDED IN 1907 TO EDUCATE STUDENTS OF DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS IN THE AREAS OF FINE ARTS, ARCHITECTURE, DESIGN, AND WRITING. THE COLLEGE PROVIDES INSTRUCTION IN A WIDE VARIETY OF MEDIA AND IS A SIGNIFICANT FACTOR IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE ARTS IN NORTHERN CALIFORNIA. THE COLLEGE HAS CAMPUSES IN SAN FRANCISCO AND OAKLAND.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The College owns a collection of artwork, antique textiles, and prints all of which were contributed to the College. The art collection, which is made up of several works of artistic significance, is on display in certain college buildings and activities verifying their existence and assessing their condition are performed regularly. The other collections, which are of unknown value, but are not estimated to be significant, are in safekeeping. Contributed collection items are not reflected in the financial statements. Proceeds from deaccessions or insurance recoveries are reflected as increases in the appropriate net assets classes. no significant deaccessions occurred during the current year.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: the vast majority of CCA's endowment is used to support its robust financial aid program. A very small portion of the endowment is used for debt service.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The principal activities of the College are exempt from income taxes under provisions of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code, Section 501(c)(3) and the California Tax Code.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: California College of Arts and Crafts' non-discrimination policy is published in both the catalog & student handbook. catalogs are typically mailed to individuals upon request and the student handbook is distributed to all students at the start of each academic year. The policy also appears in an online version of the student handbook, which can be accessed by anyone through the college's website www.cca.edu.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: THE CALIFORNIA COLLEGE OF THE ARTS MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE COLLEGE RECEIVES FUNDS FROM SEVERAL FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENT PROGRAMS. THE FUNDS ARE USED FOR STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OR STUDENT LOANS.THE COLLEGE ACTS AS AN INTERMEDIARY BETWEEN THE STUDENTS RECEIVING THE ASSISTANCE AND THE GOVERNMENT AGENCY PROVIDING THE ASSISTANCE. UNDER GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPALS, ONLY A PORTION OF THESE FUNDS ARE REPORTED ON THE FORM 990.

GrantsToIndOutsideUS.MannerOfCashDisbursement: CREDITED AGAINST TUITION CHARGES BILLED TO STUDENTS
CREDITED AGAINST TUITION CHARGES BILLED TO STUDENTS

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants Outside the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: Schedule F, Part I, Line 2: CCA OFFERS STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS TO ITS ART STUDENTS. FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED IN THE FORM OF GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS REQUIRING FINANCIAL AID. THE GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH THE AWARDS PROCESS; ONLY CURRENTLY ENROLLED AND ACTIVE STUDENTS RECEIVE GRANTS FOR STUDY ABROAD.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: CCA merit scholarships are awarded to students that complete admission application requirements by the published deadline and are based on academic achievement and portfolio review. Need-based scholarships are awarded to students with demonstrated financial need and academic achievement. Recipients of need-based scholarships and SEOG funds must complete a FAFSA application, be US citizens or eligible non-citizens, and be enrolled full-time.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: TRUSTEES ELECT BOARD MEMBERS AND APPROVE TERM RENEWALS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COLLEGE'S ACCOUNTING FIRM FORWARDED THE FORM 990 TO THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION & THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL SERVICES FOR THEIR REVIEW. THEY THEN FORWARDED THE FORM 990 TO THE BOARD MEMBERS FOR THEIR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURN. BOARD MEMBERS WERE ENCOURAGED TO REVIEW THE FORM 990 AND FORWARD THEIR QUESTIONS TO THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION. THE VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION ADDRESSED THE QUESTIONS FROM THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: TRUSTEES ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A QUESTIONNAIRE ANNUALLY AND TO DISCLOSE AND SEEK APPROVAL FROM THE BOARD FOR ANY TRANSACTION WHICH COULD CREATE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD APPROVES THE COMPENSATION OF THE PRESIDENT AND VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE AND ADMINISTRATION AFTER REVIEWING COMPARABLE INDUSTRY AND REGIONAL COMPENSATION DATA. COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS OF THE COLLEGE IS SET BY THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: They are provided either electronically or via hard copy upon request.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The financial statements are made available to the public upon request. Other policy & governing documents are made available to the public as required by law. They are provided either electronically or via hard copy upon request.

THE COLLEGE HAS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. the role of the audit committee has not changed from the prior year.
